channel.title: Statistics on Laxmikant
channel.description: Recent content in Statistics on Laxmikant

item.title: Regression in ML
item.author: laxmikant.soni@gmail.com (Laxmikant)
item.description: Definition A linear equation that models a function such that if we give any x to it, it will predict a value y , where both x and y are input and output variables respectively. These are numerical and continous values. It is the most simple and well known algorithm used in machine learning. Flowchart The above Flowchart represents that we choose our training set, feed it to an algorithm, it will learn the patterns and will output a function called Hypothesis function 'H(x)'.

item.title: Tex formulas
item.author: laxmikant.soni@gmail.com (Laxmikant)
item.description: TeX can be used to code complex statistical formulas. Mean \(\bar{x} = {\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} x_i }\) $$(\bar{x} = {\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} x_i })$$ population variance \(\sigma^2 = {\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 }\) $$(\sigma^2 = {\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 })$$ sample variance \(s^2 = {\frac{1}{n - 1} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 }\) $$(s^2 = {\frac{1}{n - 1} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 })$$ Population Standard Deviation \(\sigma = \sqrt{\sigma^2} = \sqrt{{\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 }}\) $$(\sigma = \sqrt{\sigma^2} = \sqrt{{\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 }})$$
